bhtAttempts.bht: The Christians, who were just gathered out by their labors from among the heathen, made a conscious decision to take nothing in return for their work, refusing to receive any form of payment or maintenance, as they didn't want it to be misunderstood that they sought their own worldly interests instead of the good of souls and glory of Christ. It was in the name of Christ that they went forth to preach the gospel, taking nothing of the Gentiles, avoiding any accusations of being after money.
